Mikado.subprograms.util.stats module¶

Script to calculate statistics about an annotation file. It can take both GTF and GFF files as input.

class Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.Calculator(parsed_args)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class has the purpose of parsing a reference file, calculating the statistics, and printing them out.

static get_stats(row: dict, array: <built-in function array>) → dict[source]¶

Method to calculate the necessary statistic from a row of values. :param row: the output dictionary row. :type row: dict

Parameters:array – an array of values.

:rtype : dict

parse_input()[source]¶

Method to parse the input GTF/GFF file.

writer()[source]¶

Method which creates the final output

class Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.TranscriptComputer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.loci.transcript.Transcript

Class that is used to calculate and store basic statistics about a transcript object.

as_tuple()[source]¶

Method to build a namedtuple containing only the basic information for stat building.

We want to analyze the following: - cDNA length - CDS length - Exons (number and length) - CDS Exons (number and length) - Introns (number and length) - CDS Introns (number and length)

data_fields = ['parent', 'chrom', 'start', 'end', 'introns', 'exons', 'exon_lengths', 'intron_lengths', 'cdna_length', 'selected_cds_length', 'cds_intron_lengths', 'cds_exon_lengths', 'five_utr_length', 'three_utr_length', 'five_utr_num', 'three_utr_num', 'selected_end_distance_from_junction']¶
data_tuple¶

alias of transcript_data

finalize()[source]¶

Method to be called when all exons/features have been added to the transcript. It will call the parent’s finalize method, followed by calculation of the necessary statistics.

Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.finalize_wrapper(finalizable)[source]¶

Wrapper around the finalize method for the object :param finalizable: an object with the finalize method :return:

Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.launch(args)[source]¶

Very simple launcher function, calls Calculator from this module.

Parameters:args – the argparse Namespace.
Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.stats_parser()[source]¶

Argument parser.

Mikado.subprograms.util.stats.weighted_percentile(a, percentile=array([75, 25]), weights=None)[source]¶

O(nlgn) implementation for weighted_percentile. From: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21844024/weighted-percentile-using-numpy Kudos to SO user Nayyary http://stackoverflow.com/users/2004093/nayyarv

Parameters:
  • a ((Counter|list|numpy.array|set|tuple)) – array or Counter
  • percentile ((numpy.array|list|tuple)) – the percentiles to calculate.

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim module¶

Script to trim down the terminal exons of multiexonic transcripts

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.launch(args)[source]¶

Launcher of the program. :param args: the argparse Namespace.

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.strip_terminal(transcript, args) → Mikado.loci.transcript.Transcript[source]¶

This function will take as input a transcript and then: - return immediately if the transcript is monoexonic - trim the terminal exons to a length of max(args.max_length (if longer), CDS boundary)

Parameters:
  • transcript (Transcript) – the input transcript
  • args (argparse.Namespace) – argparse configuration namespace

:rtype : Transcript

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.trim_coding(transcript, logger, max_length=0)[source]¶
Function to trim the terminal exons for coding transcripts,
i.e. the more complex case as we have to account for CDS as well.
Parameters:
  • transcript (Transcript) – the transcript to analyse.
  • logger (logging.Logger) – a logger instance
  • max_length (int) – maximum length of terminal exons.
Returns:

transcript
Return type:

Transcript
Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.trim_end(transcript, cds_end, max_length=0)[source]¶

Method to trim the end of a transcript, given both the cds_end and the maximal allowed length after trimming. :param transcript: the transcript to analyse :type transcript: Transcript

Parameters:
  • cds_end (int) – position of CDS end
  • max_length (int) – maximum length of terminal exons.
Returns:

transcript
Return type:

mikado_lib.loci_objects.transcript.Transcript
Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.trim_noncoding(transcript, max_length=0)[source]¶
Function to trim the terminal exons for non-coding transcripts,
i.e. the simplest case.
Parameters:
  • transcript (Transcript) – the transcript to be trimmed.
  • max_length (int) – maximum length of terminal exons.
Returns:

transcript
Return type:

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.trim_parser()[source]¶

Command line parser for the utility.

Mikado.subprograms.util.trim.trim_start(transcript, cds_start, max_length=0)[source]¶

Method to trim the beginning of a transcript, given both the cds_start and the maximal allowed length after trimming. :param transcript: the transcript to be trimmed :type transcript: Transcript

Parameters:
  • cds_start (int) – the position at which the CDS starts for this transcript.
  • max_length (int) – maximum length of terminal exons.
Return type:

Transcript

Module contents¶

Collection of utilities that are useful for managing Mikado.py-related files, including e.g. a statistical calculator for GFF/GTFs, an awk-like utility for GTFs, and a grep-like utility for annotation files.

Mikado.subprograms.util.util_parser()[source]¶

Function to return all available utility parsers. :rtype: argparse.ArgumentParser
